content.text: Over the summer holidays we worked with 13 young people aged 14-19 on an exciting film-making project inspired by their own relationships with nature. The group was made from young people living in London who were selected following a short application process. The inspiration for our project was the exhibition ‘A museum of modern nature’.

Across the 12 days of the project, the group worked with Peter Kelly from Chocolate Films to create three short films. In the process, they developed their film-making skills in areas such as storyboarding, filming, sound recording and editing. At the centre of the project was a three-day trip that focused on wilderness survival skills, involving a wide variety of activities from firelighting to wilderness first aid. This experience formed the main content for the group’s final films, which they decided to create in three different styles, focusing on different aspects of their relationships with nature: beauty and freedom, technology and connection, and experiences and their value.
